text.em: In the following, one writes $ U_1(p) $ etc to stress that $ U_1 (p) $ is a tangent vector at the point $ p $. But since $ U_1 $ is identically valued for all $ p $ , this notation will be dropped in later problems and $ U_1(p) $ will simply be labeled $ U_1 $

hint.comment: U1(p), U2(p) and U3(p) are required

question.text: (a) At an arbitrary point $ { p } $ express the tangent vector \[ 3 v_p - 2 w_p \] as a linear combination of $ U_1(p) $, $ U_2(p) $ and $ U_3(p) $.
